website_summaries.verdict: An awesome introduction to help anyone struggling with gluten intolerance, and a ton of simple, yet great recipes to get you started.
pros: All meals can be made in 30 minutes or less
Wide variety including muffins, lasagna, and chili
cons: More advanced gluten-free cooks may want to skip this one

customer_reviews.title: -Standard, basic information. Problem is the format, ...
customer_reviews.text: -Standard, basic information. Problem is the format, and the print and lack of proofreading. For instance, page 19 ends mid sentence. The missing information is important, essential. The recipes themselves are in smaller print, difficult to see because of the print size, font, and color of ink. And they are next to the binding, meaning the spine of the book has to be broken to be able to read the recipes. I will be returning the book because it's too difficult to read the information for me personally - (older eyes).
customer_reviews.author: Privacy_Matters

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Beginner
customer_reviews.text: If you or someone in your family has recently been diagnosed with gluten or wheat issues and you are at the"Heck! What do I do now?" stage, or if you aren't a pro in the kitchen, this book would provide you with a good starting point .If you have lived with these food restrictions for a while, this probably isn't the cookbook for you. Several of the recipes are your basic "replace flour with gluten-free flour" or "replace pasta with gluten-free pasta" recipes. Kind of already knew to do that.
customer_reviews.author: The Pod

customer_reviews.title: This book is Amazing! I love the time the author put into ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is Amazing! I love the time the author put into giving details on being gluten free. Not just recipes that are easy to follow and delicious but also how to shop, what to look for, even offering side choices when planning your meals. My daughter is NCGS but preparing dinners for a family of 6 when at least half of them are extremely picking can be overwhelming. This book has taking a lot of the anxiety out of my shopping and preparing meals for my entire family. Thank you Pamela Ellgen!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yummy recipes
customer_reviews.text: I recently started having health problems involving my G.I. tract that the doctors can't quite figure out; all testing has come back clean, even for Celiac, but eating gluten free seems to help ease my excruciating pain so I decided to order this book to help me learn a whole new way of cooking/ living..I just got it not long ago, so I've only made/ tried a few recipes so far but they're really yummy. The instructions are ready to understand and it makes it easy to know what ingredients you'll need and the time it'll take. I highly recommend!

customer_reviews.title: mixed bag
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the health conscious aspect but it's a very meat based cookbook, which surprised me since the author said her husband is mostly vegetarian. Also a lot of dependence on store bought GF products like GF buns, pretzels, tortillas, etc. instead of recipes from scratch. I avoid GMO foods and don't consider meals made with those healthy, so I can't use a lot of the recipes. Very few photographs.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Gluten Free Living
customer_reviews.text: This book had a lot of helpful information. This book offered a good background on what gluten was and where it could be found in the everyday foods that are eaten. There was information regarding the various diseases that included gluten issues. There were recipes available that showed how you could cook meals to avoid gluten. Some of the recipes were very high in calories, carbohydrates, and sugar, which I found troublesome. Anyone on a calorie restricted diet would find some recipes they simply had to skip. Overall, it is a good book to have in your library.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Good gluten free cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is well written and has recipes for foods I enjoy eating and easy to make. I haven't made any of the recipes yet but can tell by ingredients and directions that they will fit well into my meal planning .

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ideas and education
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. First the book discusses what gluten is and where it is found in foods. then there are pages on pages of recipes for the gluten free food diet for Families. Let's face it, kids can be very fussy, and very honest. If something doesn't taste good, You KNOW it. They will tell you. They won't eat it. This is a great way to have a gluten free diet and a reference material to help you.

customer_reviews.title: Read the books and enjoy a better life for Celiac patients.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gluten Free cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book for anyone who wants to eat healthy. It is nicely presented and well organized. The information about gluten and all the things you can use instead of gluten is really nice. I like that each recipe has the nutritional info after it. The recipes are varied and are easy enough to prepare by anyone. I recommend this as a beginning book on cooking gluten free. The author's story of how she had to switch is really nice.
